claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: The recombinant quad rival ent influenza vaccine (RIV4, Flublok®, Sup emtek® [EU, Canada], San of i pasteur) was the first licensed influenza vaccine to be produced using recombinant viral proteins instead of antigens derived from live influenza virus (as for in activated split virion and subunit vaccines).
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote supports the claim by stating that Flublok (RIV4) is produced using recombinant viral proteins, which is a novel approach compared to traditional vaccines that use antigens from live virus.

extracted_evidence.quote: RECOMBINANT HA EXPRESSION SYSTEMS Both prokaryotic and eukaryotic expression systems have been used for the manufacture of rHA vaccine antigens.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote introduces the concept that recombinant HA (hemagglutinin) can be produced using various expression systems, setting the context for the use of insect cells and BEVS in Flublok production.

extracted_evidence.quote: Insect cell derived rHA (RIV4) has been studied extensively by various groups in both pre clinical models and humans.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains recombinant HA derived from insect cells, supporting the claim about the production platform.

extracted_evidence.quote: Capture Purify DNA removal TFF/Formulation Purification system for the manufacture of RIV4. BV baculo virus. Figure adapted eproduced in insect cells.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote, though from a figure caption, explicitly links the manufacture of RIV4 to the use of baculovirus (BV) and insect cells, supporting the claim.
